Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks drag; bearish trends continueThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 279.70 points to 81,853.42, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 74 points to 24,694.30.

Switzerland cancels 'most favoured nation' status to India over Nestle ruling The Swiss government has suspended the MFN clause in its tax treaty with India, potentially leading to higher taxes on Indian companies operating in Switzerland. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling affecting the interpretation of the MFN clause.
Bill Gates to go bankrupt? Tesla CEO Elon Musk explains howElon Musk claims Bill Gates could face bankruptcy over his alleged Tesla short position if the company dominates globally.
Uncovered: Network of suspected scam sites lure 'dabba' tradersIndia Today uncovers a web of suspected scammer sites posing as platforms for the "dabba" stock trade, an illegal practice.

Oh Gary, how could you: Elon Musk mocks US body amid Twitter stock probeA letter from Elon Musk's attorney, Alex Spiro, addressed to outgoing US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gary Gensler, alleged that the agency gave Musk a 48-hour ultimatum.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end higher; FMCG and IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 843.16 points to close at 82,133.12, while the NSE Nifty50 added 219.60 points to end at 24,768.30.

Explained: Why a credit score over 800 mattersHigh credit scores boost financial health by offering cheaper loans, and better insurance discounts, amongst others.

Gold, silver price today, December 13, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today December 13, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Friday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Mallikarjun Kharge's dig at Nirmala Sitharaman for Nehru attack: Studied in JNUMallikarjun Kharge took potshots at Nirmala Sitharaman in Rajya Sabha after the Union minister slammed Jawaharlal Nehru for curtailing freedom of speech.

Nirmala Sitharaman invokes Balraj Sahni's arrest to slam Nehru over Constitution  Live UpdatesNirmala Sitharaman, keeping up the attack on the Gandhi family after PM Modi's explosive speech, said the first Constitutional amendment was brought by Nehru in 1951 to curb freedom of speech.

Priyanka Gandhi makes a statement with 'Palestine' bag in ParliamentA photo of Priyanka Gandhi toting around a bag emblazoned with 'Palestine' on Parliament premises was shared on social media by Congress spokesperson Shama Mohamed.

Return Nehru letters to Edwina Mountbatten, others: PM Memorial to Rahul GandhiIn a letter to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, the Prime Ministers' Museum and Library urged him to return Jawaharlal Nehru's personal letters, which were allegedly taken by Sonia Gandhi during the UPA regime.

MEC 7 fitness units, mushrooming in Kerala, infiltrated by radicals?A fitness programme in Kerala, MEC 7, is under scrutiny for allegedly being used by banned groups like PFI and Jama'at-e-Islami to spread radicalism. Both the CPI(M) and the BJP have raised concerns that MEC 7, which operates over 1,000 units across northern Kerala, had allegedly been infiltrated by Islamist radicals.

India makes big discovery in the depths of Southern Indian OceanUsing the Autonomous Underwater Vehicle (AUV), developed by NIOT, the team led by Dr. NR Ramesh was able to capture detailed images and gather critical data from the hydrothermal vents.

Mysterious drone sightings spook Americans, sparks new theoryMysterious drone sightings in New Jersey and other East Coast states have caused widespread concern among Americans. While US government agencies insist they pose no threat, new theories suggest the drones might be searching for specific substances, leaving the public uneasy.

PM expresses condolence on Zakir Hussain's death: Will be remembered as true geniusPrime Minister Narendra Modi expressed condolence on the death of tabla maestro Zakir Hussain, saying he will be remembered as a true genius who revolutionised the world of Indian classical music.

Zakir Hussain: The tabla maverick who made the world go 'Wah, ustad'Tabla legend Zakir Hussain, known for his rhythmic brilliance and global musical collaborations, died in a hospital in the US due to chronic lung disease.

Australia break India's Gabba pride between frequent rain breaks on Day 3India's resistance at Gabba seemed to be slowly fading away as the top order suffered yet another collapse on Day 3 of the third Test in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy on Monday, December 16. The day was marred by constant rain delays, which could prove to be a blessing in disguise for India in the end.

'Why this approach after being Chief Minister': Congress vs Omar Abdullah on EVMsCongress MP Manickam Tagore asked the Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister to check his facts after Omar Abdullah questioned the Congress's stance on EVMs.

Shakti Kapoor was on list of gang that kidnapped 'Welcome' actor: UP PoliceAccording to police, actor Shakti Kapoor was offered Rs 5 lakh to attend an event in UP, but the deal did not get through due to a high advance request. This resulted in the failure of a plan to kidnap Kapoor.

Kohli was dismissed for 3 while trying to play an expansive cover drive on Monday in Brisbane.

'Used my son as ATM': Atul Subhash's father accuses daughter-in-law of tortureThe father of the 34-year-old software engineer, who died by suicide in Bengaluru, has called on Prime Minister Narendra Modi, seeking justice for his son and custody of his grandson.

Mohanlal is Kirata in Vishnu Manchu's Kannappa. See first-look posterMalayalam actor Mohanlal will play the role of Kirata in actor Vishnu Manchu's upcoming film, Kannappa. Mohanlal will be seen in a special cameo.

Pics: Siddharth, Aditi Rao Hydari are all smiles as they pose with Arhaan KhanActors Siddharth and Aditi Rao Hydari were seen in Mumbai with Arhaan Khan, son of Malaika Arora and Arbaaz Khan, at a popular restaurant. The gathering also included actor Fardeen Khan, making it a star-studded evening.

India 'flat attitude' on Day 3 creeping into batting as well: Deep DasguptaDeep Dasgupta feels that India's 'flat attitude' on the field during Day 3 has crept into their batting as well on Monday, December 16. India's top-order collapsed on Monday after Australia put up 445 in the first innings.

Shakib Al Hasan given bowling ban in international cricket after ECB callShakib Al Hasan has been banned from bowling in international cricket, the Bangladesh Cricket Board confirmed on Sunday, December 15. The decision comes after Shakib was given a ban for illegal action by the England and Wales Cricket board earlier this month.

Isa Guha apologises for Jasprit Bumrah 'primate' comment: Chose wrong wordIND vs AUS: English commentator Isa Guha has apologised for her 'primate' comment on Jasprit Bumrah after the end of Day 2 of the Gabba Test on Sunday, December 15. Bumrah picked up his 2nd 5-wicket haul of the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.

IND vs AUS, 3rd Test Day 3 Highlights: Rohit, Rahul survive tricky phase as rain brings early stumpsIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS), 3rd Test Day 3 Highlights: Rain has brought early stumps in Brisbane as India managed to survive a tricky passage of play. India finished the day on 51/4 with captain Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul at the crease. They are trailing by a massive margin of 394 runs and will be eager to whittle away the deficit on Day 4.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
